alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Monroe and Noble. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marshall and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 PM EST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Martinsville, Woodsfield, Caldwell, Cameron, Dudley, Sardis, Clarington, Summerfield, Lewisville, Dexter City, Fly, Antioch, Stafford, Graysville, Harriettsville, Laings, Rinard Mills, Hannibal and Proctor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
